advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Created by Ellen DeGeneres, this riotous game-night challenge reinvents charades for the app generation. Pick a category, then hold your device up to your head, screen facing outward, and guess the words using your friends’ clues. Several categories are included, with many more available as In-App Purchases. Best of all, you can record and share videos of your friends’ increasingly frantic efforts to clue you in. Heads Up! puts a fun, fast-paced party starter in your pocket.

ios.subtitle: Guess the word with video chat

editorialNotes.standard: Swap letters and nab multiplier power-ups to chase high scores in this clever word game.

editorialNotes.standard: There’s truly nothing else like Her Story. In this amazing game, you navigate an old computer—complete with dated hums and clicks—combing video files for clues about a bygone crime. The setup is delightfully brisk, and in a matter of seconds you’ll be racing to find the truth. Her Story is smart, dark, and original—you’ll be mesmerized until you’ve uncovered the very last clip.
Finding strings of words hidden in honeycomb-like letter grids kept our minds abuzz with puzzle-solving possibilities.

editorialNotes.standard: Quite unlike anything we’ve seen before, Pry is a compelling piece of interactive fiction told through a unique blend of video, audio, and text. By pinching and swiping the screen, you delve into the experiences and subconscious thoughts of James, a troubled young Gulf War veteran working as a demolition contractor. It’s a visceral, evocative, and sometimes heart-wrenching story with many hidden secrets to uncover.
